profileAlternative.name: Andrei Schaffer, Ph.D.
profileAlternative.headline: Senior Software Engineer, Graph Analytics at NVIDIA
profileAlternative.summary:
Computational Mechanics and Software engineer with experience in sequential and parallel numerical methods and multibody systems. Concrete exposure to and development of applications in linear algebra, graph theory, differential-algebraic equations, optimization, nonlinear solvers (emphasis on global convergence), multibody dynamics simulation, computer graphics and statistical learning tools.

Long-time C++ programmer with advanced knowledge of Object Oriented Design, generic programming, design patterns, template metaprogramming, including C++11/14/17.
GPU developer with experience in Thrust / CUDA / Cusp. Parallel programming experience with multithreading and distributed systems: MPI / MPP (ParAccel).

Script programming in Tcl/Tk, Python. Haskell enthusiast.

Publications:
"Stability of the Adjoint Differential-Algebraic Equation of the Index-3 Multibody System Equation of Motion", SIAM J. Sci. Comput., vol. 26 (4), 2005.

"Stabilized Index-1 Differential-Algebraic Formulations for Sensitivity Analysis of Multibody Dynamics", J. Multibody Dynamics, vol. 220 (K3), 2006.

Ph.D. Dissertation: “ON THE ADJOINT FORMULATION OF DESIGN SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS OF MULTIBODY DYNAMICS”

Book: "On the Adjoint Formulation of Design Sensitivity Analysis of Multibody Dynamics: The Piecewise Adjoint Method for Design Sensitivity Analysis (DSA) of Non-centroidal Multibody Dynamics with Euler Parameters for Orientation", VDM Verlag, 2008.

Specialties: Computational Mechanics Engineer, C++ programming, GPU programming, Haskell programming, Sequential and parallel numerical methods, computer graphics, risk analytics.

US Citizenship.

Designed and implemented Newton and Tensor Krylov and Optimization methods for Static Equilibrium in MSC Adams.

Researching efficiency improvements of MSC Adams linear solvers through NVIDIA GPU parallel development (CUDA / Cublas).

positions.description: Implemented DiRect based global optimizer and 2D Savitzky-Golay filter in F90.

positions.title: Graduate researcher
positions.description:
Conceptualized, designed, and implemented the Parallel Piecewise Adjoint method for the Ph.D. dissertation (C++, using p-threads).

Developed modules for vehicle dynamics simulation (VDS) code using FORTRAN.

Implemented Parallel Algorithms for VDS code using OpenMP and m_fork.

Designed, developed and implemented Terrain generation with Cubic
Spline patches using C++ and OpenGL.

Implemented input parsing features for VDS using C++, lex and yacc.

Created modules for vehicle Dynamics Modeling and Simulation (DMS) software (Python).

positions.title: Graduate researcher / summer intern
positions.description: Worked as a numerical methods C++ developer for the Center for Applied Scientific Computing: implemented an automatic code generation program for complex step method in SUNDIALS integration package using C++ and ROSE.

positions.title: Graduate Student intern
positions.description:
Summer intern during summers of 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002. Worked for the Robust Engineering group. Implemented parsing features and Code Generation for DIRECT Optimization code using Tcl/Tk, C and awk.

Planned, prepared and performed implementation of tools for Robust
Engineering, Statistical Inference and Monte Carlo simulation for a
Nastran FEM Model using iSIGHT, MiniTab and MS Excel.

Added 4-wheel steering features to ground-based Simulation Software using Visual C++.

Wrote, documented and presented iSIGHT code for driving structural
design analysis in LS-DYNA, Hypermesh and Sofy.
